title: Infinitives and Ing Forms | Grammar Exercise

questions.question: She didn’t want me …………………
questions.description: Want is followed by an object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: They don’t allow people …………………. in the kitchen.
questions.description: Allow can be followed by an -ing form or an object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: They don’t allow …………………. in the kitchen.
questions.description: Allow can be followed by an ing form or an object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: I didn’t ask ....................... the bill.
questions.description: Ask is one of those verbs that are followed by an object + to-infinitive, rather than by a that-clause.

questions.question: Why won’t you let me .....................?
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I heard him ...................... the door and go out.
questions.description: Heard is followed by an object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: I suggested ....................... a job.
questions.description: Suggest is one of those verbs that cannot be followed by an infinitive.

questions.question: I prefer you ....................... me by first name.
questions.description: Prefer is followed by an object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: Be careful ..................... the children.
questions.description: In negative structures, not goes before the infinitive.

questions.question: The next ..................... was a big black snake.
questions.description: Words like first, second, last, next etc., can be followed by to-infinitives.
